history.content:
I'm like certain that the linear algebra parts of 127 will suck without 16B, especially SVD which I know is covered in 16B. For the record, I haven't taken 16B but have taken 127. However, I did also take 189, 54, and audited a good chunk of 110 so I had no linear algebra problems to my knowledge. Also as Prof. Sahai usually says, Upper Div courses are free to draw material from Lower Div courses and its up to you as the student to know everything beforehand. Of course, If you think you are up to the challenge of taking 127 without 16A/16B nobody will stop you.

EE126 is a more interesting prospect. If you rocked CS70 and truly enjoyed the material that might be a nicer class to take without having 16A/16B. It is, however, generally agreed that 126 is more difficult conceptually than 127.

children.subject: Could you recommend any of those resources to self study these topics for EECS 127? Also can you speak to the potential workload of taking EE16B and EECS 127 at the same time? I'm considering taking EE16B, Math 110 and EECS127 in the fall. I've heard that Math 110 with Stankova is not too much work and perhaps taking three heavily related courses will somewhat lessen the load, but maybe that is just wishful thinking.

I would think that EE16B, EECS127, and Math 110 would complement one another well!  Or more like, Math 110 helps with EE127 and EE127 will make EE16B's SVD a piece of cake, since it's covered early in semester for 127 and late for 16B.

Check out course website and past piazzas of EE16B if you want to preview SVD/PCA.
Is this coming from the same person who answered above who took 127? Do you think this would be too much work? People seem to say that 127 is a high workload class.

Yes, same Anon above!

Would 127 + 110 + 16B be too much work?  I haven't taken 110, so can't comment on that.  EE16B was more chill than EE16A in terms of problem sets and exam length for me, except for the lab final project for EE16B took a lot of time.  EE127 was definitely a high workload class for me, but it's pretty variable student to student based on their linear algebra maturity and familiarity with LaTeX.  I recall on the EE127 piazza, someone made a poll on how many hours spent on the once-every-two-weeks problem set.  For me, the problem set took about 24 hours and typing it in LaTeX (mandatory) took 5 hours.

Context:  Last semester, in addition to 127 and 16B, I took EE137B and ME109.  Tough semester but I survived, learned a lot, and came out with an alright semester GPA.  EE127 stressed me out the most, yet was also one of my favourite Cal classes of all time.
Ok thanks for your help. Wow four techs sounds pretty rough. From the poll what was the average time spent on the hw's if I might ask?

Just checked the old EE127 piazza and unfortunately it wasn't a poll; students just answered in follow-ups.  Here are all responses:

  • 10-15 hrs
  • 38 hrs
  • 20+ hrs
  • 10-20 hrs and 6hrs LaTeX
  • 10 hrs total
  • 12-16 hrs and 4hrs LaTeX
  • 10-15 hrs
  • 24 hrs and 5hrs LaTeX (me)

Keep in mind problem sets are due every two weeks.  From the student responses, you can see I'm on the slower end, and I think I can confidently attribute this to my weaker mathematical maturity compared to the rest of the students, plus no prior SVD/PCA exposure since I took EE16B concurrently, not beforehand.

+1 to the student's answer.  I took EE127 at the same time as EE16B.  EE127 starts with SVD/PCA while EE16B ends with it. 

Definitely having EE16B first to get more exposure to SVD/PCA/linear algebra is a plus and I wish I was able to do that (unfortunately could not with my schedule; I'm not an EECS/LSCS major).

That said, there's lots of resources online to self-study SVD.  And EE127 doesn't expect you to go in knowing it i.e. it does teach SVD from ground up, although more rigorous than 16B SVD.

Take EE16B concurrently with EE127 ?

I am wondering if this is doable or not. Will the concepts in EE127 be built on top of EE16B? or is there a overlap between two courses? thank you.

history.content: Hi friends! So I'm trying to choose between taking EE127 or EE126 for the fall. I've taken CS70 and Math 54 and will be taking Math 110 in the fall. EE127 says that it needs EE16AB as a pre-req but is it possible to still do well in the class without it? As in how much EE16AB material is there in EE127 and would I be able to just kinda learn that material real quick? Thanks in advance!!
history.subject: EE127 without EE16B
